snippet: The Agriculture Department says the average price of a dozen eggs in the United States will climb to a record this year because of the nation’s worst-ever outbreak of bird flu in poultry.
abstract: Agriculture Dept says bird flu in poultry will cause average price of dozen eggs in United States to reach record highs of $1.73 to $1.87 by fourth quarter 2015.
lead_paragraph: The Agriculture Department says the average price of a dozen eggs in the United States will climb to a record this year because of the nation’s worst-ever outbreak of bird flu in poultry.

headline.main: Bird Flu Will Force Egg Prices to a Record, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Bird Flu Will Force Egg Prices to a Record, U.S. Says
